intro: Wahlenbergia collomioides, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Wahlenbergia collomioides is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
